Allison and Margaret Engel, who are twins, have revised ''Food Finds,'' the most comprehensive guide to American regional foods and the people who produce them (Quill, $18). The 465-page book is better than ever, with all listings up to date and fortified with Web site information.

Among the hundreds of foods available by mail are Sabbathday Lake Shaker Herbs from Maine, Radd Dew's South Carolina Barbecue, Hook's Colby cheese from Wisconsin, Goo-Goo Clusters from Nashville, and Idaho Spud Toffee Candy from Boise. Others, like Kopp's Frozen Custard in Wisconsin, cannot be shipped, but the addresses are worth remembering if you are on the road.
